game.engine.image.sprite

Class WeakSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.image.sprite.DefaultSprite
      • game.engine.image.sprite.WeakSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Image, Sprite

    public class WeakSprite
extends DefaultSprite
    This implementation of Sprite caches tiles with WeakReference in order to find a balance between time and memory
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeakSprite

        public WeakSprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
          int width,
          int height)
        Create a new sprite. The given BufferedImage will be used as is. So consider passing a copy of your original image. Calls to getTile(int, int) will be buffered. So changes maybe ignored or delayed. Calls to DefaultSprite.drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) won't be buffered.
        Parameters:
        image - The image that contains the sub-images
        width - Width of one sub-image
        height - Height of one sub-image

    • Method Detail

      • getTile

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTile(int x,
                                   int y)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get a tile of this sprite. Be careful with this method. Creates a copy of the underlying tile.
        Use Sprite.drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) for faster action and less memory usage.
        Specified by:
        getTile in interface Sprite
        Overrides:
        getTile in class DefaultSprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the tile

      • getSubSprite

        public Sprite getSubSprite(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get sub-sprite with given dimension. The returned DerivedSprite is linked with this sprite.
        Specified by:
        getSubSprite in interface Sprite
        Overrides:
        getSubSprite in class DefaultSprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of first tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of first tile
        width - Width of the sub-sprite
        height - Height of the sub-sprite
        Returns:
        The sub-sprite in form of a DerivedSprite
